Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Steven Rabinowitz on behalf of the Workers Solidarity Alliance in 2011. The accession number associated with this gift is 2011.136.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. Materials are in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Workers Solidarity Alliance Records; TAM 597; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
This collection contains records from the Workers Solidarity Alliance, anarchist periodicals and a small amount of printed ephemera.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights for publicity and privacy) held by the Workers Solidarity Alliance were transferred to New York University in 2011 by Stephen Rabinowitz. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.

Workers Solidarity Alliance
Scope and Content Note
Workers Solidarity Alliance is an anti-capitalist, anti-authoritarian organization of activists who believe that working people can build a new society and a better world based on the principles of solidarity and self-management. WSA also publishes ideas and action, which was created in July, 1981 as an independent anarcho-syndicalist semi-annual print magazine. After Workers Solidarity Alliance was founded in November, 1984, ideas and action became the magazine of WSA (with issue #5), and continuing through the publication of issue #17 in 1997. It now exists as a blog on the WSA website.
